sentences.en: But now, it became a handcuff and constrained children freedom and activeness conversely.
sentences.cn: 但现在, 它却反过来成了桎梏儿童的镣铐,压抑了儿童的自由与主动性.

sentences.en: He was led away to jail in handcuffs.
sentences.cn: 他戴着手铐被送进监狱。

sentences.en: I done handcuff lightning and put thunder in jail.
sentences.cn: 我把电公拷上手铐,把雷母送进牢房.

sentences.en: Something, such as a handcuff, that resembles a wrist ornament.
sentences.cn: 类似于手腕装饰物的东西, 如手铐.

sentences.en: The soldiers handcuff the ring leader and cover his head.
sentences.cn: 士兵们拷上了团伙的头目并盖住他的头.

sentences.en: They tried to handcuff him but, despite his injuries, he fought his way free.
sentences.cn: 他们试图把他铐起来，但尽管有伤在身，他还是奋力挣脱了。

trans.tran_en: Handcuffs are two metal rings which are joined together and can be locked around someone's wrists, usually by the police during an arrest
